page.title: 04TATSFIELD VILLAGE HISTORY.
page.content: Tatsfield is the eastern most village in Surrey and one of the highest.The Church is 788ft. above sea level.The soil is clay with flint over chalk. Flint implements of early man have been found in the area.Tatsfield is recorded in the Domesday Book and paid Ship Money(three pounds) to Charles I. The Greshams of Titsey were Lords of the Manor of Tatsfield for a long period but the village now has a Parish Council with 1900 on the Electoral Roll. Mechanisation of local farms means that most people now commute by car to Croydon,Bromley,Oxted or London to work.Possible sources of the name Tatsfield: 1.Field is open land belonging to TATOL,a nickname meaning lively one. 2.The SAXON for top of a hill was TOTEHYLLE.The early name was probably TOTEHYLLEFELDE.
